org.joo.steak.framework

Interface State

  • All Superinterfaces:
    StateChangedDispatcher
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractState, AbstractStateProxy, StateLazyLoadProxy, StatePrototypeProxy

    public interface State
extends StateChangedDispatcher
    A state is an independent object which can perform business logic upon some data. The data will be passed as stateContext. It can notify the StateManager when it finishes its logic to move to next state by calling fireStateChangedEvent A state should not concern about how other states actually work. A state can be assigned an unique ID in StateManager
    Author:
    griever

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onEntry(StateContext stateContext, StateChangedEvent event)
      Called by StateManager when reaching the current state
      void onExit(StateChangedEvent event)
      Called by StateManager when exiting the current state

      • Methods inherited from interface org.joo.steak.framework.event.StateChangedDispatcher

        addStateChangedListener, dispatchStateChangedEvent, removeStateChangedListener

    • Method Detail

      • onEntry

        void onEntry(StateContext stateContext,
           StateChangedEvent event)
        Called by StateManager when reaching the current state
        Parameters:
        stateContext - the state context which may contains data to be processed
        event - the event dispatched by last state when it finishes

      • onExit

        void onExit(StateChangedEvent event)
        Called by StateManager when exiting the current state
        Parameters:
        event - the original event dispatched by this state when changing state
